TextLang.Text: Deleting... Do not turn off the power.
A connection error has occurred. The WLAN switch on the PSP™ system is not turned on.
A connection error has occurred. The WIRELESS switch on the PSP™ system is not turned on.
Press the ◀ button to go back, or the ▶ button to continue.
Press the ◀ button to go back.
A connection error has occurred. You have been disconnected from the network.
You are not connected to the network.
A connection error has occurred. You have been disconnected from the access point.
A connection error has occurred. You have been disconnected from the PPPoE server.
A connection error has occurred. There was a PPPoE communication error.
The connection to the server timed out.
Communication with the server failed. A DNS error has occurred.
A network connection for use in connecting to the Internet at a PlayStation®Spot will be automatically created.
No additional Bluetooth® devices can be connected. To connect this device, you must disconnect other Bluetooth® devices.
No access points were detected. Do you want to try again?
Press the %e button to save settings.
Do you want to cancel? The settings you have made so far will not be saved if you cancel.
Do you want to delete this connection?
You must create a network connection to continue.
Connecting to the access point... Please wait.
The characters you entered are not valid. For hexadecimal: Use 10 or 26 characters from the ranges 0-9, a-f, and A-F For ASCII: Use 5 or 13 characters
The name for an existing connection cannot be used.
Adjust settings for direct communication between PSP™ systems without using the Internet.
Adjust settings for connecting to the Internet.
Set to the channel in use for the PSP™ systems you want to connect to.
No connection name was entered. Enter a name of at least 1 character.
This operation cannot be performed when connected to the network.
A connection error has occurred. There was a DHCP communication error.
A connection error has occurred. A PPPoE server was not detected.
A connection error has occurred. A DHCP server was not detected.
A connection error has occurred. The PPPoE server returned an error.
A connection error has occurred. The PPPoE user name or password is not correct.
The port number is invalid. Enter a number from 1 to 65535.
The PSP™ system will scan for the SSID of the access point. Select this option if you don't know the SSID.
Manually enter the SSID of the access point.
Select the access point to be used.
The characters you entered are not valid. Use one of the following patterns. For hexadecimal: Use 64 characters from the ranges 0-9, a-f, and A-F For ASCII: Use from 8 to 63 characters
An Internet browser will be started after connection to the access point. Select this option when using an Internet browser for hotspot service login.
A connection error has occurred. The connection to the access point timed out.
A connection error has occurred. The attempt to obtain the IP address timed out.
The attempt to obtain the IP address timed out. The WEP key you entered may not be correct.
A connection error has occurred. The authentication timed out.
The key information exchange timed out. The WPA key you entered may not be correct.
Starting Internet browser... Please wait. After you have logged in, close the Internet browser.
The PSP™ system does not support the security method of this access point.
Automatic setup by access point type. Select when using an access point that supports wireless LAN automatic setup.
Set to connect to the Internet using a modem (mobile phone) that supports Bluetooth®.
There are no Bluetooth® modems registered. Register a Bluetooth® modem (mobile phone) under [Settings] > [Bluetooth® Device Settings] > [Manage Bluetooth® Devices].
Information required for the connection could not be found. You must enter the information manually.
Select the Bluetooth® modem to be used.
Connecting to the Bluetooth® modem... Please wait.
Obtaining information required for the connection... Please wait.
[Settings] > [Bluetooth® Device Settings] > [Bluetooth® Connection] is set to [Off]. Do you want to set it to [On]?
The characters you entered are not valid.

Internet connection availability, download speeds and data transfer costs from use of a device (including a mobile phone) connected to your PSP™ system by Bluetooth® vary depending on the service provider for your connected device. USERS ARE SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL FEES CHARGED BY SERVICE PROVIDERS OR OTHER THIRD PARTIES. Please confirm your service provider's rate plan charges in advance. Service providers' flat rate plans may not cover an Internet connection using Bluetooth® and additional charges may apply depending on download size and connection time. Read the online manual before using your connected device to download data via the Internet to your PSP™ system.

"Rakuraku WLAN Start" is a technology developed by NEC Access Technica, Inc. It is possible to make wireless LAN settings by using the "Rakuraku Start Button" of the Aterm® series. *Except for Aterm® series, a different operating might be necessary.
AOSS™ (AirStation One-Touch Secure System) is a technology developed by Buffalo, Inc. It is possible to make wireless LAN settings with simple, one-touch operation.

Press and hold the "Rakuraku Start Button" of the access point until the "POWER" LED blinks in [Green]. If you don't press the button within 1 minute, the operation will be cancelled. *Please see the manual of the product appending, about the connection method of the product without "Rakuraku Start Button".

Press the "Rakuraku Start Button" again. Press and hold until the "POWER" LED turns [Orange]. If you don't press the button within 30 seconds, the operation will be cancelled. *Please see the manual of the product appending, about the connection method of the product without "Rakuraku Start Button".
Press and hold the "AOSS Button" of the access point until the AOSS indicator starts blinking. If you don't press the button within 2 minutes, the operation will be cancelled.
There are too many access points. Perform setup in a place where there are only a few access points.
The access point was not detected.
The access point was not detected. The signal of the access point may be weak or the SSID you entered may not be correct.
A timeout error occurred during setup.
A connection error has occurred. A connection to the access point could not be established. Check the security settings for the network and try again.
A connection error has occurred. The WLAN switch on the PSP™ system is not turned on.
A connection error has occurred. The WIRELESS switch on the PSP™ system is not turned on.
A connection error has occurred. You have been disconnected from the access point.
The PSP™ system does not support the security method of this access point.
It will take about 10 seconds for the access point to be ready. Please wait...
A connection error has occurred. The connection attempt has timed out.
A connection error has occurred. The signal may be weak.
A connection error has occurred. Please try again.
Set for access to a wireless hotspot.
User authentication could not be completed. %1
A connection with the name below already exists. %1 Rename the connection.
The connection below has already been created. You cannot have more than one. %1
The characters you entered are not valid. Only ASCII characters can be used here.
The value you entered is not valid.
Use limited time promotional access from T-Mobile® HotSpot at thousands of convenient locations throughout the USA.
Use your existing T-Mobile® HotSpot service credentials at thousands of convenient locations throughout the USA.
Go mobile and stay connected! Experience the blazing fast speed of T-Mobile® HotSpot Wi-Fi service at thousands of convenient locations throughout the USA.
When the NAT type is type 3, the communication features of games may be restricted. For more information, refer to the online manual.
The router in use may not support IP fragments, and the communication features of some games may be restricted. For details, contact the router manufacturer.
You can save up to 10 network connections. Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] to delete a saved connection.
Network features are not available on this system.
